Dated:  4.12.2006 
 
 
Circular No.28/ 2006 
 
Subject:- 
Airport  Design. 
 
In order  to promote the integration of  architectural  and infrastructure 
related features necessary for  the optimum implementation  of security 
measures  into  the  design and  construction of  new  facilities and alterations to 
existing facilities at airports,  the following  instructions  shall be implemented  by 
the airport  operators concerned :- 
 
(i) 
Adequate account of  aviation  security requirements in all  airport  
facilities  shall be designed in such a way  as to maintain the integrity 
of the  National Civil Aviation Security Programme. 
(ii) 
The  architects  and designers  may identify  innovative  approaches  
while  designing  to consider  and  judge the  degree of  exposure or  
risk  to which a  building  or  facility may be subjected  if the threat  
level is  increase. 
(iii) 
Key security concerns  that need to be considered  in the planning, 
design and  enhancement of overall security shall include the 
following:- 
 
(a) Preventing the introduction of weapons or explosives or dangerous 
devices by  any means whatsoever into the airport and on board  
aircraft  by  : 
Ø Detecting weapons or  explosives or dangerous 
devices; 
Ø Ensuring 
the 
 
means 
of 
security by which  
passengers ,  baggage , personnel, cargo , mail and 
other goods  and vehicles access  aircraft; 
Ø Ensuring segregation of screened  and unscreened  
passengers; 
Ø Controlling access to and movement  within the  
airside and security restricted areas. 
(b) Facilitating implementation of  the airport  emergency plan during a 
crisis such as  a bomb alert, act of  unlawful seizure or  an aircraft 
disaster;

(c) Minimizing the effect of an explosion or  incendiary  device  on 
persons or facilities by incorporating  design features to limit 
casualties and damage; 
 
(iv) 
Separate arrival and departure  channels  for  passengers  to prevent 
possibility of  mixing. 
 
2. 
Airport  Operator  concerned shall  be responsible  to develop designs of  
a  new airport  or  altering the infrastructure at  existing airports  and will  submit  
the same   to the  BCAS for  approval.  
 
3. 
No new airport  and any alteration in the infrastructure of  existing airport 
shall be  allowed to be commissioned unless its design is  approved  by the   
BCAS  from security angle.  
 
4. 
The  above  instructions  shall be  implemented  with immediate  effect. 
 
 
 
 
 
 (M. Malaviya)
